alert.note: Alert for Morgan; Scott (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 14 at 2:27PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Morgan and southwestern Scott Counties through 415 PM EDT... At 327 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 13 miles southeast of Jamestown, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Sunbright, Deerlodge, Slick Rock, High Point, Elgin, Rugby State Park and Frozen Head State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
